text: A tube worm is a worm-like sessile invertebrate which anchors its tail to an underwater surface. It creates a mineral tube around its body, and can withdraw the body into it. Tube worms are found in these groups: * The phylum Annelida (segmented worms) ** The class Polychaetea (bristle worms) *** The order Canalipalpata (bristle-footed annelids or fan-head worms) **** The family Siboglinidae (beard worms) ***** The genus Lamellibrachia ***** The species Riftia pachyptila (giant tube worm) **** The family Serpulidae **** The family Sabellidae (feather duster worms) * The phylum Phoronida (horseshoe worms) * The order Microconchida (extinct tubeworms)
title: Tube worm
